oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Kotch McCoy to his mother Maggie Croom McCoy
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: In this letter Sgt. Koch McCoy asks about those at home and mentions that he had been seperated from the "Jackson boys." He also is concerned that his insurance is up-to-date. Sgt, McCoy served in various companies of the 343rd F.A. Regt., 90th Div. He was from Madison County, Tennessee and returned there after World War I. He worked as a switchman on the railroad after the war.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
